revised_title: Semi-Automatic Apparatus for Measuring Specific Heats: Sodium Specific Heat Study
tldr: The authors developed a semi-automatic apparatus for measuring specific heats and used it to study the specific heat of sodium between 55 and 315 K. The apparatus uses continuous heat input and maintains adiabatic conditions automatically. The specific heat measurements were found to be accurate within 0.1%, with a small anomaly observed in the region of 200 K.
